H0.text: Dominant is the trait type that probably causes the solid black coat in one of the four cubs from a litter of two spotted leopards, where three cubs are spotted and one is solid black.

H1.text: Recessive is the trait type that probably explains the solid black coat of one of the four cubs born to two spotted leopards, where the other three cubs are spotted.

H2.text: Polygenic is the type of trait that probably explains the solid black coat observed in one of the four cubs from a litter produced by two spotted leopards, where the other three cubs are spotted.

H3.text: Sexâ€‘linked is probably the type of trait for the black coat in a litter of four cubs from two spotted leopards, where three cubs are spotted and one is solid black.

A5.text: Melanism in leopards is caused by a recessive allele and is inherited as a recessive trait.

A6.text: 25% are homozygous with the recessive trait and therefore express the recessive trait in the phenotype.

A7.text: Mendel found that each pair of alleles segregates independently of the other pairs of alleles during gamete formation.

A8.text: Multiple alleles, epistasis, pleiotropic genes, and polygenic characteristics are some factors that might influence the phenotypic outcome.

A9.text: The phenotypic result often appears as a blended form of characteristics in the heterozygous state.
